title: Oskuya
text:
The Oskuya () is a river in <a href="Lyubytinsky%20District">Lyubytinsky</a>, <a href="Malovishersky%20District">Malovishersky</a> and <a href="Chudovsky%20District">Chudovsky District</a>s of <a href="Novgorod%20Oblast">Novgorod Oblast</a> in <a href="Russia">Russia</a>. It is a right <a href="tributary">tributary</a> of the <a href="Volkhov%20%28river%29">Volkhov</a>. It is long, and the area of its basin . The main tributary of the Oskuya is the <a href="Sharya%20%28river%29">Sharya</a> (right). 
The source of the Oskuya is in the western part of Lyubytinsky District, in a remote area several dozens kilometers west of the settlement of <a href="Nebolchi">Nebolchi</a>. The river flows west, crosses Malovishersky District, and turns northwest. It accepts the Sharya from the right and in the village of <a href="Oskuy">Oskuy</a> sharply turns southwest. The mouth of the Oskuya is located west of the village of <a href="Gachevo">Gachevo</a>. 
The river basin of the Oskuya comprises areas in the west of Lyubytinsky District, in the northwest of Malovishersky District, in the north of Chudovsky District, as well as in the south of <a href="Kirishsky%20District">Kirishsky District</a> of <a href="Leningrad%20Oblast">Leningrad Oblast</a>.
